title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods, Climate Change Mitigating Programme

description.narrative: The Sisters of the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary (SSHJM) Households In Distress (HID) Programme is a Faith Community Based Organisation that was established in 1991 and works in the catchment area of Mbala District in Northern Province of the Republic of Zambia. The Northern province has experienced a number of climate-related hazards including droughts and dry spells, seasonal and flash floods, and extreme temperatures. Some of these, especially droughts and floods, have increased in frequency and intensity over the last two decades and have adversely impacted on food and water security, energy and livelihoods of communities. The rampant cutting down of trees and burning has further led to soil erosion, leaving deep gullies which become unproductive land. The erosion also contributes to the washing away of the fertile top soils which are washed away by running water from an abnormally heavy downpour of rains. In areas where Chitemene system of farming has been practised for a long-time, soils have become so loose that even the wind erodes the unprotected soil. The project will seek to address these identified problems by undertaking a wide range of interventions that aim at improving soil fertility, deforestation and use of conservation agriculture. The project will also strengthen capacity in government line ministries and also conduct advocacy with the traditional leadership in trying to mitigate the climate change issues.
